title: Tiffany Trump wears all black as she stops by a coffee shop in Washington, D.C.
text:
Tiffany Trump was all smiles as she left a coffee shop with an iced beverage in hand while enjoying an afternoon outing in Washington, D.C. on Wednesday.

The 25-year-old, who is in her third and final year of law school at Georgetown University, looked to be getting some work done at the coffee shop, where she was seen sitting at a table with her laptop.

Tiffany kept cool in a black halter midi dress as the temperature soared to the mid-90s on the usually warm fall day.

Out and about: Tiffany, 25, was seen leaving a coffee shop in Washington, D.C. with a smile on her face on Wednesday

Outfit of the day: The first daughter wore a halter dress, aqua loafers, and a black baseball cap

Focused: The law student appeared to be sitting at a table by herself when she was inside the cafe, where she was seen typing away on her MacBook laptop

The first daughter accessorized her look with aquamarine loafers and a $2,390 PVC tote bag from Fendi, which appears to be her go-to school bag.

Her long blonde hair was styled loosely around her shoulders, and she wore a black baseball cap on her head.

Tiffany topped off her stylish off-duty look with a pair of dark shades to shield her eyes from the glaring sun.

The law student appeared to be sitting at a table by herself when she was inside the cafe, where she was seen typing away on her MacBook laptop.

Focused: Tiffany, who was likely doing some law school work, had a look of concentration on her face

Almost done: The grad student started her third and final year of law school at Georgetown University last month

Like most grad students, she likely stopped by the coffee shop for a quick caffeine boost while she got some work done.

Tiffany flashed a smile when she walked out holding a small iced coffee in her hand.

President Donald Trump's youngest daughter and only child with his ex-wife Marla Maples appeared to be getting back into her daily routine after traveling to New York City to be with her family last week.

Tiffany joined her older siblings ⁠— Don Jr, Ivanka, and Eric ⁠— at the United Nations headquarters to watch their father launch a blistering attack on Iran and China, which had them all wearing somber expressions throughout his speech.

Went well? Tiffany was all smiles when she left the cafe with an iced coffee in her hand

Accessories: Tiffany wore dark sunglasses to shield her eyes from the glaring afternoon sun

Designer duds: The first daughter carried her laptop in a $2,390 PVC tote bag from Fendi

Dressed for the weather: Tiffany kept cool in a midi dress as the temperature soared to the mid-90s on the usually warm fall day

Her billionaire boyfriend, Michael Boulos, was in attendance at the event, but he sat in the row behind her and her family thanks to a shortage of available seats in their row.

Ivanka's husband and fellow White House adviser, Jared Kushner, was there, as was Eric's wife, Lara, who gave birth to her second child in August.

Meanwhile, Don Jr. brought his girlfriend, Kimberly Guilfoyle, who made quite the style statement in a plunging navy dress that almost perfectly matched the design of Tiffany's royal blue frock.

The only Trump sibling missing from the bunch was the first couple's 13-year-old son, Barron, who presumably spent the day at his school in Washington, D.C. while his parents attended the global summit alongside his older siblings.
description: Tiffany, 25, was seen leaving the shop with a smile on her face on Wednesday.
